actions.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.

actions.subcommittee: Courts, Civil Liberties, and the Administration of Justice
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Courts, Civil Liberties, and the Administration of Justice.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Courts, Civil Liberties, and the Administration of Justice

official_title: A bill to amend title 28, United States Code, to provide that judicial annuities under sections 375 and 376 of such title shall not terminate by reason of remarriage of an annuitant after attaining sixty years of age, and to provide cost-of-living adjustments for such annuities.

summary.text: Provides that an annuity to a widow of a justice of the United States Supreme Court shall not terminate upon the remarriage of an annuitant who is 60 years of age. Requires that such annuities receive cost-of-living adjustments to the same extent as annuities payable from the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 28, United States Code, to provide that judicial annuities under sections 375 and 376 of such title shall not terminate by reason of remarriage of an annuitant after attaining sixty years of age, and to provide cost-of-living adjustments for such annuities.
